list: Please complete this voluntary questionnaire for {{ metadata.trad_as_or_ru_name }}.
If this business is part of an enterprise group, please answer all questions for this business in the UK only.
Do not include results for subsidiaries or parent enterprises.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures arenâ€™t available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

content.title: Definition of Innovation
list: Innovation, for the purpose of this survey, is defined as new or significantly improved goods or services as well as processes used to produce or supply all goods or services that has introduced, regardless of their origin.
These innovations may be new to you or new to the market.
Investments for future innovation and changes that {{ metadata.trad_as_or_ru_name }} has introduced at a strategic level (in organisation and practices) are also covered.

content.description: Read more information about this survey

blocks.title: Goods and Services Innovation
blocks.description: The next section covers innovation relating to goods and services.

content.description: You will first be asked to provide information about any new or significantly improved goods introduced by your business; and second to provide information relating to any new or significantly improved services.
You will also be asked to provide estimates for turnover in the calendar year 2018 relating to new or improved goods or services introduced during the period 1 January 2016 to 31 December 2018.

questions.title: Did {{ metadata.trad_as_or_ru_name }} introduce new or significantly improved goods?

list: all new or significantly improved goods (for example, improvement in quality or distinct user benefits)
goods innovations that are new to the business, even if they are not new to the market
all product innovations, regardless of their origin
the simple resale of goods purchased from other businesses and changes of a solely aesthetic nature

questions.title: Who was primarily responsible for developing these new or significantly improved goods?

options.label: This business with other businesses or organisation
options.value: This business with other businesses or organisation

options.label: This business with other businesses or organisations
options.value: This business with other businesses or organisations

list: new goods or services that were essentially the same as goods or services already available from competitors

blocks.title: Factors Affecting Innovation
blocks.description: The next section covers factors affecting innovation. You will be asked to provide information on factors deemed important when deciding to initiate or terminate innovation.

content.description: Alternatively, if you have previously indicated that your business had no innovation activities, the next section will cover Public Financial Support for Innovation received from government.

In the Public Financial Support for Innovation section you will be asked to provide information specifying the type, if any, of public financial support your business received and the source; for example, Research & Development tax credits received from UK central government.

questions.title: How important was increasing the range of goods or services in your decision to innovate in goods or services and/or processes?

How important was reducing costs per unit produced or provided in your decision to innovate in goods or services and/or processes?
How important was improving health and safety in your decision to innovate in goods or services and/or processes?
How important was reducing environmental impacts in your decision to innovate in goods or services and/or processes?
How important was replacing outdated products or processes in your decision to innovate in goods or services and/or processes?
How important was meeting regulatory requirements (including standards) in your decision to innovate in goods or services and/or processes?
